{"step_by_step_thinking": "The spinal cord is a long, cylindrical bundle of nerve fibers that extends from the base of the brain to the lower back. In adults, the spinal cord typically ends at the level of the first or second lumbar vertebra (L1-L2). The spinal cord does not extend all the way down to the sacrum or coccyx. Therefore, the correct answer is B. L1.", "answer_choice": "B"}
